name: CreateIncident
description:
Create a new incident in Datadog.

This tool is used to create a new incident within Datadog's incident management system. Trigger this tool when there is a need to report or manage an incident requiring attention.

parameters.name: incident_payload
parameters.description: A JSON object containing incident attributes like title, impact scope, and more. Include relationships and type as defined in the schema.

customer_impact_scope.description: Required if `customer_impacted:"true"`. A summary of the impact customers experienced during the incident.

customer_impacted.description: A flag indicating whether the incident caused customer impact.

fields.description: A condensed view of the user-defined fields for which to create initial selections.

incident_type_uuid.description: A unique identifier that represents an incident type. The default incident type will be used if this property is not provided.

initial_cells.description: An array of initial timeline cells to be placed at the beginning of the incident timeline.

is_test.description: A flag indicating whether the incident is a test incident.

display_name.description: The name of the notified handle.

handle.description: The handle used for the notification. This includes an email address, Slack channel, or workflow.

notification_handles.description: Notification handles that will be notified of the incident at creation.

title.description: The title of the incident, which summarizes what happened.

attributes.description: The incident's attributes for a create request.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the user.

relationships.description: The relationships the incident will have with other resources once created.

data.description: Incident data for a create request.
